refGroup.ft: [We] have seen those who are drunk in the evening and fallen on the roadside.
But what is this tyranny!
I was walking towards that Mariamman temple, thinking, "at one o'clock, in the hot sun , when the tar melts, how a person is lying down on the road side".

After the toddy and alchocol shops were closed down in the nearby villages, I know that a few drunkards come to Chennai, roam around the town as if (they) have some work, drink till they are satisfied, get intoxicated and return to the village
(I) know that, many from our town also come to Chennai, drink and go back like that
(They) come once to (my) house, see me and go away saying that (they) have many work in the city
Even if (I) invite (them) at least for one meal, (they) do not come. THTH.08
When they get the feast that they like in the toddy and alcohol shops, will they come searching and waiting for the cooked rice?

Those who come seeking for this shop stuff, thinking the illegal arrack that is made in the villages is not enough, (they) leave that without minding the good rice, will they come seeking the ration rice, the one that is cooked from the rice that got wet spoilt, become rotten and has got many colours.
But one day (I) happen to see two corpses (of people) that were caught in the train while they walked on the rail track, at the time when the electric train was coming.
A few who went walking ahead of them, realized they were drunkards and warned them not to walk on it; but they did not listen

When I felt very bad thinking they walked staggering in their drunken state and became prey to the electric train, I realised only in Chennai where there is too much traffic, the toddy and arrack shops should be closed down
When (I) saw the body that is coiled, on the road side, near the Mariamman temple, in the sunshine of day time, one o'clock, this thought only came to (me).
I walked, kept thinking, if he is drinking like this in day time, how much more will he drink when it will become evening
Two young men were standing and kept looking at him
I also went walking near the place they were in order to see what is the situation.
I asked them, "Is he a drunkard?
One person said, "No"
What else? Is it fits? Said-I
Not that also
If it is fits, will he be lying down like this for nothing" said another person
He would be of twenty years
There was a strong body
When I saw the dirty dress and sunken face, I thought that it could be some other disease
May be a sexual transmitted disease- I thought it would have been a venereal disease and turned out to be a life killing disease and the present day youngsters are very bad people.
I began walking with a kind of hatred, thinking it is fate what can we do?
In the mean time when someone brought water and sprinkled on his face, He said, Vela, Vela two times in a deep voice.
Hearing this, I who took a few steps and walked a few feet distance stopped in that very place

That time a passer by peeped in and said, "What a hypocrisy! Only hypocrisy, opening the mouth he is saying Gods' name as Vela Vela, I have seen a lot of hypocritical beggars like this. (I) have we not seen such ones who have given birth yesterday but begging feigning pregnant?" said-he
At once another person who was there," this is what the city, those who are going, cant they go simply.Is it possible to know that it is acting, as soon as (one) peeps in and sees.
As soon as I heard the word, hunger, I felt pity
I put the hand inside the shirt pocket thinking(I) can ask (someone) to buy something and give
Mean while I saw one person- I came to know that he is a college student-coming with coffee in one hand and two bananas in another hand
I returned, peeped and saw thinking let us see what is happening
Meanwhile there were around ten persons standing around him.
They tried shaking him and calling him, in order to tell him to drink coffee.
Now and then some sound came in a soft voice
But eye was not open
One man, who was standing with water in hand again sprinkled water on his face, opened the mouth and poured a little water inside
We saw the scene of (him) opening the eye and seeing
At once one student made him to get up and sit
Another person gave the copy that was in hand.
As soon as (he) saw that coffee cup, his hands that were unconscious, with great desire pulled that coffee cup and kept it in the mouth.
Even before the one who was in the opposite side finish saying,"it is very hot, be very careful" the whole coffee went inside his mouth.
I have never seen the desire and the greediness that appeared in his eyes at that time.
That look was as though those eyes will not give it to the mouth but swallow both the coffee and the cup
At once, in his face there was no suffering even if there was dryness, there was no torture of hunger even if there was tiredness.
Now he is smiling and bowing his head and kept reclining, he said something
Those words were not heard in anyone's ear
He wanted to lie down on the floor
One person, prevented (it), told him to move near the wall of the Mariamman temple and made him recline on that wall
Mean while another person bought a piece of bread and another cup of coffee and gave
At once because of the torture of his hunger they also got lost
(He) said what a relief and being tired he reclined, looked around in fear and shed tears
Pity increased for every one
One person asked, Which town (are you from)
(He) said, Madurai, in a little clear voice
Where did you come?
For survival only, Sir! My state...!
Let it go! What is the problem with your body?
Saying, It has been five days, sir, he was beating his stomach and was about to cry
At once the crowd started dispersing slowly
There were four people
(I) asked whether he can get up and walk
Saying in a pleading voice , god, please wait, wiped the sweat in the face and was stretching and folding the legs
After that even the few people who were there also, slowly walked off
The student who gave coffee only was standing there
The college bell that was near rang
As soon as (he) heard the noise of that bell, he also kept looking back
In the end, I alone was standing there
Some kind of desire instigated my mind to ask and know the real state of that youth
That is why I stood there, with out being able to start
(I) asked him again whether he can get up?
(He) said, I feel very tired god
I invited saying, if (he)comes till the house he can eat stomach-full and come
(He) said, tell me where is the house, when the tiredness is over, I myself will come
Why should you walk this way after getting this much tired.That too, like this at midday hot sun can you come like this,asked-I
Only a little more distance, Isn't it? He became quiet after saying, I came walking staggering thinking I want to some how reach this Mariamman temple
Afterwards, he was about to cry and wiped his eyes with his dirty clothes
I also waited thinking there must be some real reason
(He) sighed and cried saying, I will not survive THTH.82
I consoled (him)how much ever I can THTH.83
He was sobbing and telling should I die in the city without dying in the native town? THTH.84
(He) was disturbed and said, that is why I came to this temple, thinking I can die here THTH.85
You are an orphan, aren't you?why it matters to you where you die?(I) asked what special piety for you towards this temple. THTH.86

Not piety god.It is a habit for the one who came with me a person from my town to do worship with coconut and banana here and go He will come(He) said that he came here thinking at least he will be near while dying and take care of him
(He) said that he came here thinking at least he will be near while dying and take care of him
He got up slowly
He staggered and came walking step by step.
On the way, he sat on the wall of a bridge, on the pial of one house and somehow reached home
I had decided not to ask anything till he finish eating
After eating his face had both tiredness and clarity
(He) reclined on the pial slowly
There is so much goodness in you.(He) said, I will lie down here for a while and then will go
(I) thought this is a good opportunity and begin to ask till my dobut is clear.
Didn't you say that the person from your town comes here, what is his job? like that I asked many questions

He never misses a day night without coming to the temple.Even if he misses one time, he goes to the temple that is near his house worship and liedown.Then also (his) thought is on this temple only, like this he answered for all the questions that were asked
Though he said all these, he was hiding his name and the job. THTH.99
So, I had much desire that I must know that
After compelling, he said he works like him as a coolie,but he never struggle with out cash, coolie work and food and his name is Velan, told-he
As soon as I heard the name Velan, it came to memory that he was saying Vela Vela when he was unconcious

I was surprised that how much trust he has on his friend that he mumbles his name even when he is unconscious and when he who is such a good friend who daily worships id there why should he go with out food (lit.be dry)
Mean while I realised that young man was feeling sleepy
He reached the state of sleeping in a short time
I got up went, after finishing my duties, returned spread the carpet on the pial, was lying down and tried thinking a lot about him, Velan,and what would be Velan's job
I was being confused without knowing the truth
I became bold that somehow I should ask and know(it)
A little time passed by
Suddenly, he got up, sat and said, if you were not there today I would have died
Like this, Munisamy, who came with me became prey to the sand of the city, saying like that he was staring at a nearby stone.
Thinking that, before the doubts that raised were cleared, I asked, whether he also came with Velan, when Velan had money and food, why this Munisamy alone had to die of starvation.
We are not as courageous as Velan (lit.Velan's courage will not come to us).
Velan has studied a few months in the school also
I have never studied
Munisamy stopped studying after third
Not only that, Munisamy does not like all that Velan does
Munisamy says often that it is not good, it is sin
So Velan was angry (lit.anger (came) to Velan)
He never helps to Munisamy
From the money that (Velan) gives to me, I give a little to Munisamy without Velan's knowledge.
He does not get that also
Velan's money is sinful, it is better to die than to get that, saying this he will deny to get it
So he had to starve many days
One day when he came in the train (he) gave his head (in the train).
I did not know that also
Velan only told that he saw thagt corpse after two day
At least I do not have father and mother
If I die there is nobody to cry
To that Munisamy, though there is no mother he has father
He is poor
Even then if he hears what a suffering will he undergo, saying like that he was shedding tears.
Thinking this is the good time, I told him you do not die like a mad man in a hurry, as if giving him comfort
I will do my best help
Whenever you are very hungry come here
I asked him to tell the truth without hiding several time
He opened his mouth about it only after I assured him that I will see to it that no evil will happen to him and I will not reveal it to anyone.
Then also, he began to say only after a long introduction.
God, you don't tell it to anyone
If you say it will be an end for my life also
For many days he was afraid that Munisamy may tell about him to police
So, he had doubts about Munisamy
But, Munisamy is agood person, even for enemy he will do no evil.
Velan is also a good person
Since there is no other way, he is doing this work.
I am scared even to think of it
One day he had asked me to keep a costly pen
That whole day, I was in a corner without going out
I was shivering to even see the policeman
(We) are not courageous like Velan (lit.Velans courage will not come)
Saying don't tell anyone god, he looked at my face as if to plead me
I gave the assurance again
He was turning here and there and was talking
He joined a gang on the fourth day of his coming to the city.
There were five or six gangsters in that group
At all times they stand and wander from China Bazar to MoorMarket
Some times they stand in the places where bus stops
They will be there where people are crowded.
Velan has joined them
Either me or Munisamy did not like it
He is the one who saved us giving coffee and banana whenever we were hungry with out getting coolie
One day we saw five ten rupee note with Velan

Velan said that, "some one was going with a money purse in his shirt pocket, one from those five or six people, cut it and gave it to another person, that was given to another in turn and another in turn and it had come from Modern cafe till central station and when it reached Velan, he has taken five currencies from that."
Hearing this Munisamy started off with anger on us
Velan ran and hold his two legs and pleaded not to tell police
Munisamy asked him to promise not to do that work anymore
Velan also gave promise
But did not do as told
One a person like you said ,crying, in China Bazar that he lost his money purse and lost two hundred rupees
Hearing that, Munisamy called me aside and said, Velan is doing sin by making many peole cry like this
One day I asked Velan alone with mercy
He promised saying, that he does not do anything but be only a support to others in helping the robbed thing to change from hand to hand
After Munisamy's death I never ask any thing to Velan
I let him go as he likes
But I was also not worried about my starvation
I have not seen him for five days
He has not come to this temple also for five days
I know if he had come
He never go away with out keeping at least a little coconut, in a niche in the corner of the east side eaves
There is no coconut there for five days.
I searched in China bazaar and Moor market
No where is to be found.
When I could not even walk only I came to die here in this temple
I came thinking, if he comes late in the night, I can see him
I am very anxious in my mind
I went on sleeping
He said thinking about that only I woke up suddenly
Even before (I)finish saying it is dangerous to pick pocket, he got up, holoding my two legs and cried pleading, do not tell god
It was tiring to regain his confidence again
For a few seconds he was staring at some thing
After that he himself told me "once he took me to police and asked me to be in the prison for two days saying that he will take me out for sure on the third day"
I, who did not do any fault was closed in the prison for his sake.
But with out fail he came took me away on the third day
None of the police were enemy to him
Because he has much money daily, everybody is kind to him
But Munisamy and I were afraid even to walk in China bazaar.
Even then everybody threatened us
Velan wears ironed dhoti and ironed shirt like you, some days he get pants for rent, wear good slipper and walk around
Though he had this much courage, when I think that he has not come for five days and is not to be seen stomach is churning.
I do not know whether he is in Hospital or in prison?
If I were a sick person he will look after me, if I were in the prison, he will come and make me free
He has money
But where will I search? What help will I give? How can I make him free? Where do I have money, saying like this he kept staring at that old stone and sighed a big sigh.
Mean while a person came towards the home searching for me, entered inside and nearing and was saying , good heavens, I was not sure whether you will be at home
I called him inside and was talking to him
As soon as the talk was over, when (I) came out and saw, that young man was not there
How much ever I gave the assurance, I realised he did not have trust on me.
I kept quiet, thinking, his going is also good , why is this trouble for us
After two weeks this has happened, one day evening I was coming towards home in the good moonlight.
My eyes that have seen that Mariamman temple stirred up my memory
There was one youth falling and worshipping
In front of him there was a bunch of bananas and a big coconut.
He broke the coconut and lighted the camphor
He was standing for a long time, folding his hand and was looking at something.
The memory of Velan came to me
I thought it is not possible, he is some one who is a true devotee and wanted to walk ahead.
I thought let me see whatever it is and was sitting on the pial that is next to the temple and was watching , acting as if I was a person who came to rest.
He took that bunch of bananas, called a few children who were going on the road and give one each
He took half of the coconut and gave each a little
After the children had left, taking the other half, he came to the east side corner of the eaves
He put his hand in that stone niche,kept taking something and was throwing it away slowly
I heard him sighing each time
At last he walked away slowly
After he walked a short distance, I saw him taking his kerchief and wiping the eyes and walking
Sorrow filled my heart
After a little while I went near that stone niche, put my hand inside and saw.
I saw that half coconut was kept as such there
With out my knowledge, my mouth said owe unto (him).
I came off
I thought let me see what was it that he threw and went to that place and saw.
The moon was shining better as the clouds gave way.
In that place the coconut pieces were fallen down, lying down dry, were filled with ants, lying down with out any one to care for. Were soaked in the tears.
It is all taboo to think of what is what after death
At the same time can't help of thinking about it.
Time...age... death,... after death....?
Leg is paining
There is pain in the knee for the past fifteen days.
For few days, it has been not possible for (me) not to get up
Whether leg is needed for the story or not, leg is needed for writing the story
Use of leg is also a habit (lit.Leg is also a habit)
How many creatures are there without legs!
Among men, those who do not have legs, those who do not have ears, those who do not have eyes, those who can not talk, have achieved and have written so much.
It is as if (they) must write.
But the mind is anxious.
Mind spends most of the time in anxiety.
Time, itself is a creation of mind
Even this world also is a creation of mind
How many live beings which can be seen or not seen are there!
But their world is not like the worlds of man's mind
For each life there are different worlds according to the suitability or ability of mind
But only for man there will not be one world at all times
Even one person has different worlds at different times and at different status of mind
Many days ago one bunnyan tree was my world.
It was a big tree
But not a special tree.
The trunk is not even four feet high
But if (we) climb four feet there are branches to climb in all directions and angles.
From the branches there are sub branches
After that there are aerial roots
one summer, I and another four or five people, having tied the subbranches and aerial roots together, created something like a nest.
Having climbed the tree, (we) must enter the cage, through a small hole
We have covered the roof of the cage with other leaves and dry leaves
We waited for rain to test the nature of the roof
Sun is not smart enough to test the roof
But rain is not like that.
It is rain which is hero of roof
That time the village where I was, was not famous for rain.
The rain that rains for the whole year there is poured out here in Chennai within four days
After building the nest, as soon as the rain started for the first time (I) ran from house to the tree.
Being fully soaked, climbing on the tree (I) entered the nest
Rain did not enter the nest
Only after a little while, in a few places, through the aerial roots and branches that were around water began to leak.
But the water that leaks, with the aerial root or branch, through it will go down.
Always there was for me one or one and a half feet place that is not wet
It appeared to me that I may spend the whole life time inside that nest.
There are black ants in that banyan tree
(I) have seen it biting and even blood oozing
That day also, the ants were seen
There were many ants
At first I had fear
But they did not bite (me)
Even when they were crawling on me, they did not bite me.

When many ants were going here and there, they not biting me, as the gap became more and more, the fear that was on the ant were reduced little by little and there came a stage when there is no fear at all.
When (I) lost so many other things, there was no great longing.
But that nest even now is creating longing.
Recently-it also, that is, what is said as recent also, is a strange creation of mankind.
Few years back, When (I) happen to go to that village, (I) went to see that banyan tree in all eagerness.
There was the tree.
But there were many changes in the surrounding.
Infact, because of the changes, at first (I) was not able to identify that tree.
Earlier, the tree used to be like an ancient temple or a tower in the open space.
Now, houses are there very near to that.
It appeared as though the tree itself will not be left for many days
The floor beneath the tree itself was raised.
The tree has lost many portions by self and others, it also looked as if it had become black
There no sign of the nest that we built and left earlier.
But when looking at it keenly, one of the nails that was used to build an attic for the nest, alone was there.
The head of the nail was buried deeply in the branch.
There is no reason for others to know that, that (particular) dent is different from other numerous ridges and dents that were there in that branch.
As soon as I saw that dent, I thought to try touching that nail's head with eagerness
It was possible only by the little finger.
(I am) not sure whether the finger touched the head of the nail or other portion of the dent in the tree branch.
That dent appeared like a nether world.
In a few people's belief all those who are dead are going only to the nether world
How many people would have died from the time mankind appeared?
Many many billion...
That many people, all are in that nether world.

When we are in the world we say: he is a king, he is a teacher, he is an accountant, he is working in the shop, she is a doctor, she is working in the news paper, he is an engineer, he is a homeopathy doctor...
What will they be doing in the nether world?
Nether world teacher, nether world doctor, nether world engineer, nether world accountant, nether world story writer...
Even after going to the nether world, should (they) continue doing what they have been doing in the outside world?
It will not be so
There are those who consider nether world as hell.
Even if there is pain in hell, there is no possibility of having regulations, plans and needs of this world
There will be much rest
When (I) think of that rest, it appears that (I) should go to the nether world now itself
Is it for that I searched for the nail head that was in the pit of the branch of that banyan tree
There is no rest now.
The knee, that has pricking pain has given only a pseudo rest.
To say it is a rest with pain itself is a taboo.
But this pain will go away in a day or a week or a month
But it appears that there is no rest possible even then
You would have brought the umbrella won't you? Said-I
"Holding the umbrella in one hand, it is not possible to ride the bike" said Appu
"I would have come holding it"
"Look! only a little more distance"
But the rain was more
It is not good to keep going beyond in the road by letting the body a victim to rain.
More over the one bundle of books and the papers (that are to be given for) printing, all are written manuscripts.
That too they were written by fountain pen.
I am the one who is proud of writing with the fountain pen.
The warm feeling (I) get, the beautiful shape that the handwriting get, the feeling of no pain in the hand, about all these, how many times, with how many people, it was told.
(MY) mouth was not tired of talking about the varieties of fountain pens and the varieties of imported ones
Talking of the fame of the time of the pen with the friend.
Even when all were lost, broken and spoiled and gone, the old fountain pen, the family property, the one I have saved as gold, is the one that is the famous brand of 'Ratinam &sons' pen.
During the time when (We) protesting against foreign rule, asking for freedom, it was a time when efforts were taken all over the country to satisfy our people with the native products.

Appu knows that I still have the rich heritage of Ratinam &sons native made pen that came out for sale to compete the foreign made "parker", in the Chennai Rajdani (train), resembling that (the parker) in the appearance and standard with the 14 carat golden nib.
(My) experience is, if the papers that are written with the fountain pen, gets wet in the rain the letters will be erased
(My) friend parked the vechicle near that big house, saying "it is not good to go ahead"
A very old house
The wooden gate was open
When (my) friend having pushed the gate with legs opened (it),we also entering quickly, reaching the portigo, escaped the rain.
Have (You) looked at the house? Said Appu.
(I) kept looking.
(We/one) can not say it is a very old house.
(The) house looked old, because of the algae of the rain water, (and) since it was neither white washed nor painted
It was raining steadily
"It does not look as if some one is staying" said-I
"It has been like this for many days: said Appu.
"What?" asked-I with eagerness
"Once a robbery took place here"
"This is a house where robbery took place"
"Here and there roberry is usually taking place"
In our house also it took place twice"
Appu was talking by keenly observing that house
"The robbery that took place here is big"
That injustice took place when all went to the nearby town
Abba, some thing is happening even to think of it, what to tell...
This time without any necessity (I) took my antique pen kept looking at it as if looking at a new one.
I do not know whether this habit of looking at some of my rare books, things like the pen, with the foreignness as if I am looking at as if it is new-is it only with me ?
I some times look at some of the things that belong only to me (and) that I love very much, as if I am a foreigner
At that time a sort of restlessness overwhelms within me with out a sign of happiness
(I) feel like hiding it with out any one's knowledge
Next I do that also
Till I finish doing it, restlessness will be there
A restlessness as if some one is spying at that thing, which belongs to me, which I love and cherish, which I look at as if I am a foreigner
Yes that is that restlessness
Only when that restlessness subsides, I can be my self, transformed from being a foreigner
Only after I become myself I can do all things
If that restlessness has to settle, I have to hide that particular thing, yes my thing there is no doubt about it.
If not that will be snatched
(It) will be robbed
How many times have I hidden my beloved things
During the times of my friends' coming, I have to pretend as a thief and a liar
My rare books....
Each friend who comes home, the one who loves book, right when he reaches near the book makes me restless
I will not be at rest inside when he keeps the book one by one, when he takes it out to see and when he tries to give an over all reading,(thinking) whether he will ask for borrowing it(lit.free)
Many that have gone has not come back
MSD who borrowed a book saying he will read and give has not returned until now
That is a very very rare book
Thirty years are over since he has taken it
When it so happened that he had to meet me by chance in a few public places, he has played hide and seek
Only then (I) removed the books from public sight, built secret shelves and placed them there.
Once again Appu murmured saying, "This is a house where robbery took place"
It took place when (we) went to the nearby town
They removed every thing including, fan and tube lights also
They have brought a lorry and scooped (all the things)
When (we) came and opened the door, the house was empty
Then, whose (things) were stolen?
Appu said, "our things only... we were the last ones to stay in this house.
Rain also stopped

When we looked at the sky and were about to leave, a female dog was coming from under the stair case with its long nipple that has just fed the pups and went ahead of us as if it has more important job than we
There appeared four beautiful pups
(My) friend left me in the stop, as usual when (we) finish the press work, and went saying he will meet me again
After two days I searched for my treasured pen
(It) was not found
Many of my things are like this: a few times, it will not be found, when searching -(it) makes me kept searching
Rathinam and sons fountain pen, of which I was proudly saying, our family treasure since my grandfather's time, a native pen that is handed over to me, made me search
It was not in the shirt that got wet
As soon as I come home I usually take the pen along with the purse and hand kercheif and keep them in the table drawer
Purse, hand kercheif, office key, all were safe
Rathinam and sons pen was missing
Except me, others in the house do not touch my things
Even then I asked them
They said," we didn't see at all"
Each one of them had half a dozen very modern gel pens
None of them needed my old fashioned fountain pen
Some times when I search for the first two times, play hide and seek and then it will be found
This is the first time for this pen to disappear
I told about the loss of the pen, when I called (my) friend for some reason
He said, "Is it? (you) have not given me"
That day evening I went to that house where robbery took place
When (I) opened the wooden gate, the mother dog that came along with the pups, barked without wagging its tail
Bending down I took stone
It went backward and barked more loudly
Hearing that other dogs from that street came out from all corners, assembled at the gate, kept jumping and barked.
(It) was not found even if I some what searched for it
When people began to stare at me hearing the barking of the dogs I moved away from that place fast
The loss of it was heavy (on me)
In the effort of continuosly searching for it, one or two things that were lost long back was found
It was as if the thought of loss was lying hidden under the other thoughts
One day I went to Appu's house
(He) was eating
His last younger brother came running
(He) would be ten or twelve years old
He said,"Uncle, I got first prize for hand writing"
I said, "very good, show (me)"
He opened his hand writing note book and showed (me)
It is to be well appreciated (lit.It should be pressed on the eye)
"With what are you writing? Is it fountain pen or gel?"
"Fountain pen only"
"It is what elder brother gave"
"Bring it we will see"
He went running and brought it.
It is a famous American pen that is made in India and is sold
Appu also came out
He said, "Only last week I bought (it) for his birthday"
We started walking on the road
He said," doubt is bad"
"I have another perspective
In the effort of searching, there are many things.
Doubt also is needed to search
If we take doubt as a an urge, it also has a role in searching" said I
Removing his spectacles, he began wiping (it) with the handkerchief.
"Latchuman", I asked, "why do they say 'that fool Venu' whenever (they) talk about him(lit.whenever talking time about Venu)?"
"What? Don't you know about Venu?"
"Being in Mampalam, it is surprising if you say you don't know about Venu."
Even though it was surprising to him, I had to accept that I did not know.
At once he started telling the story enthusiastically
You know about Venu, don't you?
He used to keep a shop here, didn't he?
At that time he was staying only in Mampalam
He used to come and go to the shop only from there
One evening he started at Port station
One evening he started at Port station.
Having bought the ticket, as he was walking on the platform, his mind was preoccupied as if he was mad
That day there was no crowd in the train
As he was walking on the platform, a beautiful girl was coming to catch the train.
As soon as he looked at her, he became crazy.
He (also) kept on following her(lit.He continued behind her).
She climbed into an empty coach
He was wandering along the platform, feeling embarrassed (lit. embarrassment flowing).
How to talk with her?
That was what a big problem
Then the bell rang for the train to start as well
At once, without prior thinking, he also climbed into that coach and sat on the bench opposite to where she was sitting.
She, having looked at him, started reading the book that was in her hand.
Now and then she chanced to look at him.
The one who was reading the book that was in her hand suddenly started laughing.
It seemed to Venu that all this happened because she was attracted by his handsome appearance.
He was unable to speak(lit.tongue did not run for talking)
He was unable to speak (lit. tongue did not run for talking).
(He) got up
All of a sudden, he embraced her and kissed her.
She freed herself by jumping up, shrieked and pulled the chain
The train came to a halt.
Cars (and) police all assembled there
The matter was known
Venu was arrested, (but) as soon as he went to the police station, he was freed on remand
At that time I was with a daily newspaper
Venu came to see me the next day
He did not know what to do.
He asked me what to do.
I scolded him saying, "Go, you fool, should you behave like this in these matters?"
There is no other fate
It was pathetic to look at him.
I went to see the magistrate, to do something about it.
I discovered that her name was Shanta, she was of the Brahmin caste, she was living with her uncle since her parents had died and she is now working as a teacher.
The magistrate said that the girl's uncle had filed a case; if he were to withdraw it, he could avoid the police case.
What to do for that?
How would that girl's uncle be?
It was only possible( to know) by going and meeting him
That day at three in the afternoon I went to see him.
He was a pensioner, mad about theosophy
His wife was also like that.
As soon as (I) knocked at the door, a girl came and opened the door.
A beautiful girl; yes, she (is the one)
There is no surprise in what that fool did.
I asked whether uncle is there?
She invited me inside.
Her uncle did not know what to do, since a journalist had come to his house to see him
(Also,) he had a special love for our journal
After the formalities were over, I related the reason for my coming.
I told him clearly that, because of this case, the matter would become publicised and talked about.
He also felt the same.
But did not say anything conclusive.
He said that he had to consult his wife.
But I told him that the case was coming to court the next day.
"If it is to be done, it should be done today", I said.
He asked me to remain there till he went at once to Tiruvallikeni and came back.
Nobody was in the house except me and her.
I began talking with her.
"What a problem there is because of this case!
How many will laugh (at it) when standing in the court!"
I am telling you it just like that.
"You should have taught that fool a lesson and got into another carriage without shouting about it", I said.
She laughed
"All that you say is quite correct.
. At that time I was afraid.
I was afraid that a mad fellow was coming to kill me.
That fool didn't speak a word", she said.
I was laughing and said, "Accept that you have to forgive.
Nevertheless, (what happened) is no surprise with someone...like you..."
She also laughed more than me.
"There is a lot of difference between desire and doing."
"What will you do if I suddenly kiss you?", I said.
"Isn't there a difference between that and this?"
She looked straight at my eyes.
"I also know both are not the same.
Moreover, are you a fool like him?"
She looked (at me) with a side look, saying "Moreover people like you..."
At once, even before she tried to stop, I gave a kiss on her cheek.
Excuse (me)
I would also like to go to court like that Venu", I said humbly.
"Why?", she asked.
"I have never seen such a beautiful girl as you
. It is a real pleasure to kiss you
For that I will accept any punishment", I said
She also began to laugh.
"You are a funny person", she said.
Even before she finished speaking, I again embraced her and kept kissing her on the face and lips.
She freed herself and said, "You are a beast, talking with you itself was a mistake".
"Excuse me, excuse me. I love you."
I told an utter lie saying, "My love for you has been growing ever since I saw you a year ago.
I met you a year back in Chennai.
It was then that I fell in love (with you).
"It is not for the sake of Venu that I came here.
It was to see you that I came, with that as an excuse", I said
She also embraced me and kissed me
It would be 7 o'clock at night.
Her uncle returned
The two of them talked and decided on the way itself, it was said.
They said they would cancel the case
I got their answer and the acceptance of Shanta and came out
After that, recently I happened to meet her
She was married to a D.E.O.
Her husband greeted me with much respect
He greeted me with much respect saying Shanta had often told him how respectfully and maturely you behaved in the matter of that fool Venu.
Social worker Ponnambalam wandered like a dog.
Is it possible with out wandering?
What he has taken is a big matter and a great responsibility.
All that he can do is to serve and to wander for serving the public.
It is better to say like this, rather than saying like that: He is one among those who can not remain quiet, without wandering and suffering for the cause of public.
He is an ordinary poor man
He can not give money lavishly, but he can give hard work
Ponnambalam was spending that hard work which is the treasure, for public service and public matters.
One river was flowing in between and was separating the village that was on north and the village that was on south.
It is just a small river.
For eight months only sand flows.
In the remaining four months water flows beyond the two sides out of control.
Since there is no good bridge, the villagers who are that side and the villagers who arethis side were sufferring
An old stone bridge which was built by some Chola king's time was there ten are fifteen miles far away from the village
If (one) wants to go on the river side till that bridge and reach the other side, it was delayed because of the longest route
Every one wished that there is a bridge -that is convenient for those two villages - near the village, it would be so useful
Social worker Ponnampalam watterred this wish
Are there not several plans such as five year plan, social development plan, village welfare plan?, for all that, (he) applied, having got signature from those two villagers
Ponnampalam had read a lot about one minister to lay foundation another one to open it when it is over
Ponnampalam thought that the government people will consider their village bridge under any one of the plans and will finish it.
But for the government people had greater work than building the bridge for Kuruvipatti
They kept quiet thinking, there is no loss(lit.family will not sink) if they do not build the bridge now for Kuruvipatti
Is it not a shame even to think of buiding a bridge for Kuruvipatti when there is a intensifying political situation to manage civil and foreign problems
So every body else except the people who are in Kuruvipatti and he people who are at the opposite side refused to think about the bridge of Kuruvipatti
What to do for that?
Is it possible for those who are in government to think off unnecessary things?
Some times they even forget that they are in government
So they have left Kuruvipatti and it's bridge thinking what if damage happens to it
But people of Kuruvipatti is not ready to leave liket hat.
Those village people were industriuos(lit.had hard work) and they had self respect.
They have to forgive those who went to the rule by getting their vote promising that they will build the bridge of their village, but forgot about it.
Had it not been for the weakness of mutual forgiveness, this world would have improved and grown long back!
Is it some thing new for this country of India, which is going into ruins(lit. becoming a small wall) by taking pride in easily forgiving many scoundrels in the name of virtuous deeds
The people of Kuruvipatti and their beloved social worker, Ponnampalam, came to a final decesion.
It is no use trusting in a government that has no concern and thought for their village to build a bridge across the river of their village.
Perhaps, sometime the government would have forgotten that there is a village called Kuruvipatti under their rule
So, they came to a definite decesion that they themselves will build the bridge of their village
Ponnambalam is the one who gave the encouragement and inspiration for them to come to that decesion
The stones for the bridge were quarried from the granite mountain near the village
They made a common lime kiln for the village and slaked the mortar
For a few needy expenses, Ponnampalam has collected money from both the villagers
That is why we had mentioned in the beginning that he was wandering like a dog and worked hard
The people of both the villages, worked hard for the bridge in their lesissure time.
They all, with out any differences of male, female, youngsters and old peolpe
In seven eight months the work of the bridge was over (lit.bridge finished)
Ponnampalam made the bridge that came into being by the hard work of the villagers, to be inaugurated by the Kuruvipatti panchayat (village adminstration) president who is good person
Everybody praised and celebrated Ponnampalm's hard work
The people of the both the villages who had the occupation of farming enjoyed the benefit of that bridge.
The bulls that carried the plough, bullock carts, carts that carry fodder, all of them were coming and going through that bridge.
The relationship and aquaintance between the villages became close.
Because the people of both the villages were farmers, the bridge was very useful and essential for the trafic of the carts.
The region beyond Kuruvipatti belong to another province
There drinking liquor is not prohibited(lit.there is no liquor prohibition)
There is horse race

The rich, who were going arround ten miles for drinking liquor and horse race through the stone bridge that was built during the time of Chola king, considering that as a round about way now a days are going by the Kuruvipatti bridge.
The bridge that was built by Ponnampalam, the social worker and the villagers was built for own and limited use

The villagers were experiencing trouble, since in the bridge that was built mainly for the need of the villagers-where ploughing bulls, bullock carts and fodder carts can go - now cars and lorries started going
From this side and that side, lorries and cars were swarming without time for the wooden carts and bulls to enter (the bridge)

Like the proverb "the wife of the one who waited for her, the one who came yesterday has taken away", the bridge that was built by the villagers was not useful fo rthe villagers but began to be useful for those who have cars.
One day a rich person from the town, who went to horse race and returned, having drunk fully, got intoxicated came in the Buick car.
When the car was coming in the Kuruvipatti bridge, it dashed against a wooden cart and the driver of the cart fell down into the car's wheel, got crushed and died.
This incident has opened the eyes of the people of Kuruvipatti
From the next day all the villagers joined together and did blockade on the bridge saying (they) will not allow the cars, lorries.
The cars that came eagerly thinking about the horse race and the drinking of liquor, because of the blockade returned with dissapointment.
At the entrance of the bridge, social worker Ponnampalam, along with four more people, holding the hands together did not give any place to enter.
One great car owner, without regarding their blockade, got down and shouted (at them)
"This bridge does not belong to your father
Who are you to do the blockade?
I know all the ministers.
If (I) write one word they will put you in jail (lit.will push you inside)
Ponnampalam was not angry at his words
He replied him softly.
Sir, this bridge came into being because of the hard work of the villagers.
We, the poor farmers built this bridge, mainly for the wooden carts and ploughing bulls to go
Government did not give a pie to build this bridge.
But now, all the time, cars and lorries occupy this bridge.
The carts of both the villages are not able to go.
We are not able to forgive that our hard work is being wasted.
Two ofr three days back, one wooden cart driver got crushed in the car and died
Here after, we are not ready to allow this holy bridge to be useful for the drunkards, and who are crazy about horse race."
"Nonsense! do you know who am I?
How dare you talk with me arrogant like this!
If I shake my index finger, all the ministers who rule this country will come running and stand (infront of me) in obedience.
Do you know that?"
"I do not need to know that sir!
Now, you can not go through this bridge.
Greetings, you may return" - like that Ponnampalam stopped talking.
He frowned at him and got into the car and returned
Blockade continued
They allowed only the wooden carts and ploughing bulls to go on the bridge.
They did not allow the cars and the lorries
For that they did not harrass those who came in cars and those who came in lorries
"We have built this small bridge for the sake of the villagers.
Please forgive us for not allowing you
If you go a little distance, there is a stone bridge.
That is a public bridge, that belongs to the government.
Use that, do not come here." like that they send them away in humility.
All those who have cars are rich, all the rich are favoured by the government
What a shame! Will they keep quiet, if they can not go on the village bridge?
Is there anything not possible for them?
They talked with the minster and the high ways' commissionare in the telephone from where they were.
They declared the unjust act that the villagers are doing
As a result?....
Next day, an advertisement board, along with the approval ofthe high ways' officer was hanging on the bridge:
Through the way of this bridge, cars and lorries alone can go; wooden carts should not go
This is the command of the government
Those who disobey will be punished
Yours, commissionare, Highways department.
Social worker, Ponnampalam and the villagers did not stop the blockade
They did the blockade, opposing even the command of the government.
Will the government people keep quiet.
Many, many lorries full of special reserve police came to the spot
They just beat and kicked
Many forsook the blockade and ran away for fear of beatings and kickings.
Ponnampalam and two or three people did not stop the blockade
This bridge is our birth right
We will not let it down
Our hard work belongs to us alone.
"Give one blow on his head"
A rough police beat him.
Ponnampalam fell down as blood flows from the head
He lost his consciousness
When he became conscious and opened his eyes and saw, cars and lorries were going happily on the bridge
This society, which will not improve, does not need such bridges now a days.
First of all, a new bridge should be bulit to join the distance between the poor and the justice.
That can not be built by stones and motar" like that he was murmurring, got up staggerred and walked.
That was a village road.
On that road was a ruined hall.
Opposite to the ruined hall was a babul tree.
In the favour of that tree, some wild creeper has spread on it.
Since the wild creeper had ripen stem and the head became old, ripe leaf alone was there without falling on the ground.
Near the root of the stem, on the neem tree there is a hole.
At the entrance of the hole, right under the old leaf there is a small sand ball
One black ant in a majestic physique, rubbing the mustache gently came out.
Murmuring, 'It's a long time since (I) have seen the world', the ant who was like the lion that roams free in the lonely forest, having turned its head from one end to the other, looked at the world.
A small ant came in front of it in a hurry.
The big ant asked about the well being of the small ant saying in a roaring voice, "what boy are you well?"
The small ant without being able to answer the question that was asked, shivering, ran back the way (it) came
Having murmured saying, "Do (you) have fear, (you) will live", the ant which was rubbing the mustache, when (it) stood up (and) raised its head to see...
"What is this in between?" "something hides(the view)"
Oh! is it this mountain?
(It) took a few steps ahead, kept its hand on the sand ball, lifted the head and looked at those who return from the market.
Who knows whether it knows about Bimasenan who is fixing his club on the earth and standing?
It's manner was like that only.
Who is it? Human beings aren't they? (They are very much sluggards)
Suddenly it got a doubt:
Who is more in the world? Is it human beings or our ant gang?
It kept thinking about it.
It was not able to calculate properly
What if (I) call one of them and ask?
That too is correct
Having stood behind the sand ball, stretching the head, lifting both the hands, opening the mouth that was like a split mustard and said roaring , "hey human beings, one of you come here"
That is all! All the human beings that were going on the road scattered and ran: ran and hid in the old mansion.
They ran and hid themselves in the ruined hall.
The ant was clapping , and making noise saying "Oh! Oh! "Are you that much scared looking at me! Look you, coward boys!" and went round and round the sand ball.
"What is this? In this summer season it is raining? Summer rains are like that only"
The ant heard the words of those men who were talking in the old mansion
The ant was surprised saying " What? Rain!"

What is this? It is absolutely crazy! Rain? Who cares? Even I am standing outside. It is true that the sky is dark! The ant was making fun, laughing and jumping saying, "Are (they) afraid for that this much? Absolutely coward boys; Rain? Who cares?"
When (it) was surprised thinking about human beings that , "these human beings are like this only. They make a big fuss for nothing", the sky suddenly became clear and shining spreading light.
The human beings who took shelter in the old mansion walked away.
The mocking laughter of the ant did not fall on their ears.
In a few moments, steam evaporated and heat came out from the drops of water that were on the earth.
Another crowd was walking on the road.
One person was fanning saying, "how sultry it is?"
The water that was on the old leaf that crept on the babul tree, having rolled one by one, gathered in the center stem and became a big ball; the ball that was gathered slowly rolled down
The pearl that was assempled, slowly rolled
Following the water ball that fell on the head of the ant that was mounting on the sand ball, the old leaf also dropped off and fell on the sand ball.
Shouting saying, "Alas flood, alas flood, the sky is broken and fallen", the ant that came out removing the old leaf, shrieked looking at the sand ball that dissolved
The ant with out knowing what to do, ran in a hurry shrieking saying, "Look human beings, escape, run quickly, flood has come, run, run!"
Having fanned with the towel, one person took shelter under the tree saying, " What a heat it is!"
Look crazy human beings, (you) are running for nothing as if the world is rolling away, now when a great danger has happened, (you) behave foolishly don't you?
No! no! I am ashamed of you.
Now, how will I look after myself?
The ant run helter skelter, went and entered its hole saying, " How will I save myself? It looks as if the flood will come?"
There is elephant here
There are elephants here
(He) went to take
Taking (he) went.
(He) went without taking.
If taken it is good.
He came
He had come.
He was coming
Beautiful girl
Hot day
Wind is blowing hot.
Flower is bloom beautifully.
He is the prime minister
He is the college principal
He was the prime minister
He was the college principal
He will be the prime minister
He is the college principal
They are good cows
Those are good cows
He is a tall man
He is a tall person
That is my pen.
That pen is mine
Lamp is in the room
Lamp is not in the room
Younger brother was in the room
Younger brother is sleeping.
(He) is sleeping.
I am reading the book.
I am writing the story.
I am telling you a story.
I will show her to you.
He is cutting the tree with a knife.
That coffee cup...
The real state of that youth...
Those eyes...
The present day youngsters
That one small coffee cup of yours...
In those times, Caesar Augustus gave a command for all those countries that belong to the Roman rule. That command asked all the people to register their names.
That was the first registration. It happened when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
All the people travelled to their own cities inorder to register.
Joseph left from Nazareth, atown in Galilee. (He) went to the city called Bethlehem, which is in Judea. Bethlehem is David's city. Joseph went there, because he belongs to the family of David.
Since Mary was encaged to be married to him, Joseph and Mary registered together. That time mary was pregnant.
When Joseph and Mary were in Bethlehem, the time came for the baby to be born.
She gave birth to her first son. There were no rooms in the lodges. So Mary wrapped the child by the clothes and laid (it) in the place where cattle eat their fodder.
That night a few shepherds, watched their flock in the fields
The angel appeared before those shepherds.The Lord's glory shone arround them. The shepherds were very much afraid.
The angel told them, " do not be afraid. I am going to tell you agood news. That will make everyone happy.
